name: Ville-en-Kit
description:
Ville-en-Kit is the result of a challenge: build an entire game in less than a month.

Being a fan of Tetris and city-builder games, my game borrows from both genres: you will get buildings "falling" into your city, and its up to you to figure out where to place them before they reach a dead end. Each building gives or costs money when it's placed, you will also get bonuses depending on what's around it.

If the standard map is too small for you, there's also the big map and the extra-large map!

You can also choose the visual theme of your city: modern cities will have factories, schools, police stations and so on delivered by helicopter, medieval towns are being helped by a flying godly hand, and the ancient Egyptians use slaves to build pyramids, temples and work in the fields!
